required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Natural History Study of Serious Medical Events in PWS
clinical_study.official_title: Non-Interventional, Observational, Natural History Study of Serious Medical Events in Prader-Willi Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: PATH for PWS is a study to help researchers better understand serious medical events in PWS over a 4-year period, as well as evaluate how PWS-related behaviors change over time. The data from this study is intended to inform the development and clinical trial design of potential new treatments.

detailed_description.textblock: Every 6 months, participants or their caregivers will be asked to update online surveys about medical problems and serious medical events, as well as provide information about conditions and behaviors often associated with PWS such as hyperphagia. Because this is an observational study, no study drug will be provided and no visits to a doctor or clinic are required.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the incidence of serious medical events
primary_outcome.description: Serious medical events are those that result in death, are life-threatening, require hospitalization or an emergency room visit, or are medically significant

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the incidence of non-serious thrombotic events
secondary_outcome.description: Thrombotic events include blood clots in a blood vessel, such as an artery or vein

secondary_outcome.measure: Analyze D-dimer concentrations in a subset of participants who agree to provide a blood sample
secondary_outcome.description: D-dimer is a protein in the blood that is present when a blood clot is forming or has formed

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate prescription medication use associated with serious medical events and thrombotic events
Evaluate the change in height-adjusted weight
Evaluate PWS complexity using an online survey
Evaluate the pattern of hyperphagia behaviors using an online survey
secondary_outcome.description: Hyperphagia means the intense, constant hunger that often occurs in individuals with PWS

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate hyperphagia management using an online survey
Evaluate food-related behaviors using an online survey
Analyze medical information to evaluate the natural history of PWS
secondary_outcome.description: Medical information will be from birth to before enrolling in the study

study_pop.textblock: Participants with PWS who are at least 5 years old and live in the United States, Canada, Australia, or New Zealand

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Participants must meet all of the following criteria:
- Confirmed diagnosis of PWS
- At least 5 years of age
- Live in the United States, Canada, Australia, or New Zealand
- Must be enrolled or willing to enroll in the Global PWS Registry (https://pwsregistry.org)
Participants or their caregiver must also meet all of the following criteria:
- Have access to the internet to complete online surveys at least every 6 months
- Agree to receive reminders to complete online surveys
- Allow the staff to ask questions about survey responses if more information is needed and to enter data into the surveys
Exclusion Criteria:
Participants or their caregiver meeting any of the following criteria will be excluded:
- Is not able to read and understand English

link.description: PATH for PWS / PATH-PWS-001 Study Website

patient_data.ipd_description: FPWR allows for registry use by request and releases de-identified data to the public.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data access will be governed by the Global PWS Registry advisory board.
